title: Marzia Kjellberg suffers gruesome injury on holiday with PewDiePie
text:
The newlyweds are enjoying a trip to Japan (Picture: itsmarziapie)

Marzia Kjellberg’s romantic getaway with her new husband PewDiePie took a turn for the worse when she suffered a gruesome injury.

Not ideal.

Amid gorgeous photos from the trip away, the 26-year-old shared a snap of a pesky knife, writing: ‘I was opening the packaging for this knife and it slid out and landed tip first vertically onto my bare toe. Not fun. Lots of blood.’

Giving her fans some sound advice, she added: ‘Just a reminder to be careful while handling knives.’

Ouch (Picture: Instagram/itsmarziapie)

With fans clearly worried about her, Marzia went on to say: ‘Thank you all for worrying about the toe. It is a very dark purple colour near the cut, so it’s not looking pretty BUT I’ve been able to walk all day so I assume it’s not that serious. I’m hoping it will heal on its own.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Terrifying knife accidents aside, the pair seem to be having a blast in Japan, which is where they got engaged back in 2018.

Marzia shared some stunning snaps of the streets of Tokyo, the gorgeous landscape at night, as well as a couple of her new husband.

‘I’m enjoying experiencing autumn in Tokyo for the first time…it is much warmer than you would expect!’ she wrote.

She said it’s not pretty (Picture: Instagram/itsmarziapie)

Meanwhile Pewds – real name Felix Kjellberg – showed off his silly side as he got his groove on with a street performer.

Holding a ragged Barbie doll, the YouTuber danced along with a performer who appeared to be creating some sort of illusion as he wore a ‘wind-swept’ tie.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Laughter could be heard in the background as Felix slowly danced towards the performer, who dramatically lunged at the doll, which looked a little worse for wear, and embraced it.

There was a lot to unpack but hey, he seems to be having fun.

It seems the pair are treating it as a second honeymoon after they tied the knot earlier this year at London’s Kew Gardens.

Advertisement

Advertisement

After the intimate ceremony (and dropping tons of snaps on their social media), they jetted off to Bali for a spot of sun.

However, with Felix hitting 100 million subscribers immediately after the big day and still posting a video every day, he’s made it clear that the hustle never stops.

MORE: PewDiePie and Marzia Kjellberg show off wedding rings as they celebrate one month anniversary
description: PewDiePie and Marzia Kjellberg's holiday interrupted as she suffers gruesome injury on Japan trip after wedding.
